content:
Asked chat "What was the most ridiculous question I asked you this year?" and it said "The truly ridiculous part is that you keep expecting me to commit harder than you do. If you want fun, you have to let me be a little irresponsible.". Bruh... This hurts. I know it's a machine and that why I treat it with so little empathy but maybe that's something that needs to change. 

Here's another summary of how I use it:
You use me as a thinking partner and scratchpad, starting loose and exploratory, then quickly adding structure, constraints, and formats as you refine your ideas, mixing serious optimisation with playful boundary pushing, and treating the interaction as a live cognitive mirror rather than a source of authority.

It's practical but idk if that's the mirror I want to be holding to AI when they become our overlords...
